description: While the boys are waiting for the School Bus, Cartman explains the odd nightmare he had the previous night involving alien visitors.
After being shunned by the others kids, Damien, the Son of Satan, calls upon his father to fight Jesus in the ultimate Pay-Per-View Boxing Match between good and evil.
While Mr. Garrison deserts the class for a visit to Tom's Rhinoplasty, Stan, Kyle, Kenny, and Cartman all compete for the attention of Ms. Ellen, the new substitute teacher.
The boys' discovery of a prehistoric relic spawns a monster that threatens to destroy South Park and the world.
Who is Eric Cartman's father? It could be anyone who attended South Park's 12th Annual Drunken Barn Dance.
When Cartman's environmental essay wins a national contest, America's sweetheart, Kathie Lee Gifford, comes to South Park to present the award.
A weekend trip to experience the finer points of camping, fishing and blowing animals to smithereens is threatened by an erupting volcano.
When Stan discovers his new dog Sparky is gay, he becomes so confused he loses his will to play in the big Homecoming Football game against North Park.
Kyle's mom will not let him keep his new pet, an elephant because it is so huge. So the boys turn to Dr. Mephesto to genetically engineer a smaller elephant.
Grandpa's sole birthday wish is for Stan to take part in his assisted suicide. Meanwhile, Mrs. Broflovski has organized a protest against the boys' favorite TV show, "Terrance and Phillip".
A mishap at the morgue transforms the residents of South Park into brain-eating zombies and threatens the boys' night of Trick-or-Treating.
Mistaking Cartman for a starving African child, government authorities send him to Ethiopia where he runs into Sally Struthers.
While South Park Elementary is attempting to stage a non-denominational holiday play that will not offend (or entertain) anyone, Kyle checks himself into the South Park mental asylum.

Chef  returns to South Park after spending time away with a group called, "The Super Adventure Club," but when his strange behavior starts getting him in trouble, the boys risk everything to save him.
In his new role as School Hallway Monitor at South Park Elementary, Cartman must team up with Kyle when they discover a teacher having sex with a student.

Satan is throwing the biggest Halloween costume party ever. Just like a girl getting ready for her sweet sixteen, every detail must be perfect for the prince of darkness. The antics of the most notorious serial killers of all time threaten his fun.

South Park Elementary faces strong opposition to the topic of evolution. Cartman's too busy to notice as he plans to propel himself into the future on the precise release date of the newest, hottest game console.

Eric Cartman has frozen himself in an attempt to make his three-week wait for a Nintendo Wii pass quickly. A freak accident landed him over 500 years in the future and now, he's stuck in a Godless world on the brink of war with no Nintendo Wii.
Stan Marsh has hit rock bottom. He's got no job, no bicycle and his only way out of a bad situation is to coach the local pee wee hockey team.

Cartman and Kyle are at war over the popular cartoon, "Family Guy". When the creators of the show announce that they will show the image of a religious symbol, the network threatens to ban the episode. Cartman sees this as his chance to get "Family Guy" off the air for good. The two boys embark upon a mad chase across the country and the fate of "Family Guy" lies with whichever boy reaches Hollywood first.
After leaving Kyle injured on the side of the road, Cartman races to the headquarters of "Family Guy" determined to put an end to the show once and for all.
Towelie gets over his drug addiction and writes his memoirs. With Oprah's support, his book becomes a best seller and his story inspires millions to turn their lives around.
Al Gore warns the school about the threat of ManBearPig.
When Cartman's mom realizes she can't control her son anymore, she gets help from an expert. The "Dog Whisperer" may have what it takes but Eric Cartman's not going down without a fight.
The boys dedicate their lives to defeating a mad gamer and saving the World of Warcraft.
The world's biggest conspiracy of all time is finally uncovered when Eric Cartman exposes the true culprit behind the September 11th attacks.

After Randy Marsh experiences an unfortunate incident on national TV, the "N" bomb hits South Park. While Randy seeks forgiveness from Jesse Jackson, South Park Elementary invites a midget by the name of Dr. Nelson to talk about sensitivity.
When the entire contents of the world's imagination lay open before them, Stan and Kyle step right in. Back in South Park, Cartman swears he's seen a leprechaun.

Stan and Kyle are being held in the bowels of the Pentagon until they tell the government how they got into Imaginationland. Meanwhile, Cartman simply won't rest until he finds Kyle and gets him to make good on their bet to suck his balls.

Inside Imaginationland, Stan and Butters engage in the battle of their lives as they fight the army of evil imaginary forces. Meanwhile, Cartman goes all the way to the Supreme Court to get Kyle to pay up on their bet.
Stan Marsh and Kyle are hooked on Guitar Hero. Unfortunately, Stan's superior skills on the video game damage his friendship with Kyle.
The girls in the fourth grade class have made a secret list that rates every boy's looks from cutest to ugliest. When the boys steal the list, they are completely unprepared to deal with the results.

When his "ultimate plan" to embarrass Butters backfires, Cartman struggles to keep his classmates from seeing a compromising photograph. Meanwhile, Butters is sent to a special camp where they "Pray the Gay Away."
An infestation of head lice plagues South Park Elementary. When Mr. Garrison refuses to name names, Cartman finds a way to detect who has lice in the hopes of making fun of his unfortunate classmate.
While Cartman follows a lead on a possible terrorist attack, Hillary Clinton makes a campaign stop in South Park for a big rally.
Determined to get the real story behind why he has to decorate eggs for Easter, Stan falls in with an eccentric society that guards a legendary secret.
As an increasing number of homeless people are begging for change all over South Park, the boys work to solve the homeless problem once and for all.

Cartman discovers the joys of having Tourette's syndrome. Drunk with the power of saying whatever he wants without getting in trouble for it, he lines up national TV coverage to take advantage of his new life with no filters.
Stan's dad becomes South Park's home-town hero when the guys down at the local bar see the size of his most recent crap.

Cartman finds himself fighting for his life after a routine tonsillectomy goes wrong. When Kyle becomes infected with Cartman's ailment, the two won't stop for anything as they search for a cure that will reverse their otherwise certain mortality.
While the world struggles to contain an epidemic of epic proportions, the boys find a way to make money off of it.
Giant guinea pigs are attacking cities all over the world.  The boys have the key that will save everyone from the onslaught but they're stranded in the Andes Mountains.

While the country celebrates, the President-elect catches everyone off guard when he arrives at the White House prematurely. From the Oval Office, the new Commander-In-Chief assembles his team and prepares for the job ahead.
The boys must embrace the latest fad to hit South Park Elementary or risk their status as the coolest kids in school.

Butters is sure he's seen a Vampire at school but he can't get anyone to listen to him. Tired of being teased at school and punished by his parents, Butters joins the Vampire group and becomes "ungroundable." Meanwhile, the Goth Kids are angry and frustrated when the other kids can't tell the difference between a Goth and a Vampire.
When the boys help Britney Spears get to the North Pole, they discover the shocking secret behind her popularity.
In a South Park homage to the 1981 film, "Heavy Metal", the boys are trying to get Kenny off the latest drug craze that's captured the junior high and under set.
The head of the World Canadian Bureau leads the country into a long and painful strike and the responsibility of brokering a settlement rests with the boys.
The citizens of South Park wake up and find the internet is gone. When Randy hears there may still be some internet out in California, he packs up his family and heads west.
While the kids are on an educational field trip to a living museum, Cartman makes Butters sneak away from the class to go to the amusement center located next door.
With the rest of the American people haunted by the memory of a recent tragic event, only Butters will stand with Cartman as he confronts the Chinese.
Wendy gets in trouble when she threatens to beat up Cartman after school.
Kenny takes his new girlfriend Tammy to a Jonas Brothers' concert where they each get purity rings.
After attending their first WWE match, all the boys want to be professional wrestlers.
Stan takes action to stop the Japanese from killing the world's whales and dolphins.
The boys fight back against the loud and obnoxious Motorcycle Riders that are disrupting everyone in South Park.
Cartman is chosen to do the morning announcements at South Park Elementary.
The boys' fun-filled day at the water park is about to turn deadly.
"The Coon" rises from the trash and takes his place as a lone vigilante who wipes out crime in the town of South Park.
Randy steps forward with a solution to fix the desperate state of the economy.
Someone plays an April Fool's joke on the boys and it doesn't go over well.
Cartman and Jimmy come up with the funniest joke of all time.
Randy has a plan that will assure Stan a first place trophy in this year's Pinewood Derby.
Cartman's dream of living the life of a pirate will come true if he can just get to Somalia.
Ike is being tormented by paranormal forces. Kyle brings in professional ghost hunters to help save his little brother.
Butters is determined to get his first kiss so his friends won't make fun of him anymore.
The latest in scientific testing reveals that some of the boys at South Park Elementary have a sex addiction problem.
When Stan is sent to the school counselor because he's holding on to an obscene number of useless possessions, he realizes that Mr. Mackey has a hoarding disorder too.
"Coon and Friends" set out to help the victims of BP's latest catastrophic drilling accident in the Gulf. Much to the Coon's dismay, another Super Hero gets there first.
Mysterion's true identity is revealed. Meanwhile, The Coon, scorned by his fellow Super Heroes, is out for revenge.
Coon and Friends find themselves at the mercy of Cartman who now has the dark lord, Cthulhu, doing his bidding. Kenny wrestles with the curse of his super power through his alter ego, Mysterion.
Randy's obsession with the Food Network forces Sharon to explore a new interest of her own.
The boys are given a controversial book to read in school and it inspires them to write one of their own.

Cartman's favorite restaurant has been shut down and replaced by a store that sells medicinal marijuana. Randy is desperate to get a prescription card to buy pot and Cartman will do anything to get his beloved fried chicken back.
When Kyle begs Stan to "friend" him, Stan gets sucked into Facebook.

This show marked South Park's 200th episode. Led by Tom Cruise, two hundred celebrities, previously ridiculed by the town of South Park, file a class action lawsuit. They demand immunity from ever being made fun of again. When Stan begs them to accept his apology, they offer impossible terms and the boys ask the Super Best Friends for help.

In the exciting conclusion to this two-part blockbuster celebrating South Park's 200th episode, angry celebrities, violent ginger kids, and Mecha Streisand face off against the Super Best Friends and the South Park faithful. It's a destructive battle on the largest scale, but all everyone wants to know is, "Who is Eric Cartman's father?"
Jimmy and Timmy are off to summer camp with all their handicapable friends.
Cartman dreams of being a NASCAR driver and he's willing to do whatever it takes to make it happen.
New Jersey is taking over the nation one state at a time. Randy and the boys take a stand as the Jerseyites approach South Park.
Kyle is intimately involved in the development of a revolutionary new product called HumancentiPad.
The kids' most scandalous secrets are being leaked on an outrageous new gossip website.
After Randy takes Sharon to see a hit musical, he becomes Broadway's biggest fan.
The 99% is ganging up on Eric Cartman.
The boys are getting close to discovering the truth about the first Thanksgiving.
Kenny ends up in the foster care system after his parents are arrested.
Jimmy hosts the Special Ed Department's First Annual Comedy Awards.
The Prince of Canada is about to take a Princess and Ike is obsessed with the Royal Wedding.
Cartman throws a fit when the boys' penis sizes are posted on the school bulletin board, and is sent to anger management therapy.
Kyle gets in on the ground floor of Cartman's latest business venture, The Crack Baby Athletic Association.
Butters is diagnosed with multiple personality disorder.
Just after Stan's 10th birthday, his worldview starts to change and so do his friendships.
Cartman finds a unique way to cope with Asperger's Syndrome.
Cartman joins the United States Border Patrol.
When one of the boys leaves the toilet seat up after he uses the bathroom, an unspeakable tragedy occurs.
Cartman signs up for a home security system.
It is time for Butters to begin a journey where he will follow in the path of his Hawaiian ancestors.
Randy's big plans for Halloween night keep Stan from trick or treating with his friends.
A serious doping scandal shakes everyone's faith in a beloved icon. Everyone who once supported the fallen hero is now cutting off their symbolic yellow wristbands.
Cartman launches his own gem shopping channel.
The kids are in danger when new trends start to evolve and shift at a rapid pace.
The town's big Easter Egg Hunt is in jeopardy when Cartman produces video evidence of a mysterious creature lurking in the woods.
Butters is the victim of an unlikely bully.
The boys' ziplining adventure becomes a terrifying test of survival.
The time has finally come for Cartman to let a special someone know exactly how he feels.
South Park Elementary takes steps to address football's concussion crisis.
Cartman finally admits he's fat and immediately gets a mobility scooter.
Cartman infiltrates the NSA and doesn't like what he finds in his personal file.
When Wendy tries to fix one of her girlfriends up with Butters, she ends up in the counselor's office.
The boys use the game of Minecraft as a distraction to keep their parents from hurting each other.
Cartman sees Token as a threat to all humanity.
The Goth Kids are being sent away to a camp for troubled children.
When Ike hits puberty, he and Kyle start to grow apart. To save their relationship, Kyle takes Ike to see a live performance of Yo Gabba Gabba!.
Cartman's latest prank brings peace to the world.
The boys prepare to battle the crowds already lining up for the first official day of holiday shopping.
Black Friday is almost here and the battle for the new gaming devices is heating up. Princess Kenny's betrayal has left Cartman out for revenge.

The doors to the mall will finally open for the biggest Black Friday sale in history. The boys are divided over which gaming device to buy and a bloody battle will determine whether Xbox or Sony will be the winner.
The boys name their new start-up company, The Washington Redskins.
South Park goes gluten free.
Randy is harboring a giant secret and the pressure is getting to him. Meanwhile, Cartman calls Stan a cissy.
Timmy's successful new car service makes him a lot of enemies.
Graphic video from an unknown drone is uploaded on the internet.
Stan is addicted to the new Terrance and Phillip mobile game.
Butters is convinced he's living in a virtual reality.
There are illegal goings-on in the basement of City Wok.
The boys express their utmost respect for Caitlyn Jenner in the most stunning and brave South Park ever.
Kyle has chosen a dangerous alliance over his friendship with Stan.
Garrison wants to build a wall to keep out all of the undocumented immigrants.
The town of South Park is gentrifying and Kenny thinks it's time to get a job.
Cartman considers himself the top on-line restaurant reviewer in South Park.
Cartman is the latest victim of body shaming.
The Asian Girls in school are drawing dreamy pictures of Tweek and Craig.
The citizens of South Park decide they no longer need a police force in town.
Jimmy's integrity as a newsman runs smack into PC Principal's ideology.
PC Principal disappears with two of the 4th grade students.
Terrance and Phillip must save Terrance's little daughter, Sally, and all of Canada from an evil dictator.
The kids' parents only have their best interests at heart when they arrange for Stan, Kyle, and Cartman to be exposed to the chickenpox virus.
Is the new planetarium a harmless place to learn about the solar system, or the scene of a diabolical plot to control the minds of South Park's citizens?
Stan and Kyle are psyched to have Wendy and Bebe visit their clubhouse for a game of Truth or Dare, but first they have to build one.
South Park's 14th Annual "Cow Days" rodeo and carnival is here and the boys are determined to win Terrance and Phillip dolls.
After a huge loss in court, Chef is left penniless, but he has some very famous and talented friends in the music business who want to help their old mentor.
When Sharon Marsh's Aunt Flo makes a monthly visit, she brings a mysterious pet fish for Stan.
Cartman, Stan, Kyle and Kenny are assigned to write a report with Tweek, the very nervous and highly caffeinated boy who insists gnomes are stealing his underpants.
The boys' discovery of a man encased in ice threatens Stan and Kyle's friendship.
The boys wait for Dr. Mephesto to regain consciousness and reveal the identity of Cartman's father.
Mr. Mackey, the school counselor, is fired and turns to drugs and alcohol. Meanwhile, when the boys find out what it means to be circumcised they try to save Ike from his bris.
When Barbrady resigns, anarchy ensues and the boys pitch in to help.
With Pip as their star player, the South Park dodgeball team is off to the championships.
Jimbo and Ned's efforts to drive up the ratings for their new hunting show on the cable access channel threatens to edge out an old favorite, Jesus and Pals.
A freak accident leaves the South Park Elementary School Bus teetering precariously on the edge of a cliff.
The entire town is gearing up for the annual 4 July celebration when a ban on fireworks is imposed.
South Park's first film festival attracts crowds of pretentious, tofu-eating movie lovers to the quiet mountain town.
Garrison is still hot on the campaign trail.
Cartman finally understands why Heidi wants to get him to Mars.
Kyle's dad manages to keep his identity as a troll a secret while he takes his on-line abuse global.
Gerald is thrilled with the media attention as he continues to troll everyone and anyone.
The boys band together to stand up for their rights.
Giant Douche wants out of the Presidential race.
An entire city in Colorado gets hacked. Gerald and Cartman may lose everything when their complete history of internet activity becomes public.
Gerald comes face-to-face with the Troll Hunter.
The new President-elect pays a visit to his hometown.
Cartman is certain that Butters is trying to steal his girlfriend.
Protestors armed with tiki torches and confederate flags take to the streets of South Park. Randy comes to grips with what it means to be white in today's society.
The children of South Park claim to have seen Mr. Garrison lurking around town and they're frightened. The town comes together to make the President go away.
When Tweek is caught in the middle of a petty conflict, it drives his relationship with Craig to the brink.
In a return to form, a forbidden love story between a white man and a Native American man unfolds. However, the boys' story exploits people's misery for laughs.
Professor Chaos has found the perfect tool to spread lies and misinformation about Coon and Friends. In trying to save their reputation, the boys come face to face with Mark Zuckerberg.
Drugs are flowing into South Park. A passionate young health advocate has traced the source of these illegal meds and is about to expose Stan Marsh.
This year at the traditional Halloween get together, a witch casts a spell that terrorizes the town and ruins Halloween for the boys. Cartman sees a way to use the witch's power to his advantage.
Kyle doesn't understand why Heidi won't break up with Cartman. He's playing with fire when he gets in the middle of the school's most talked about couple.

Jimmy and Timmy's project has caught the attention of some very important people. Their experiment could have far reaching implications that could save the world… and they might even win first prize in this year's science fair.
PC Principal is wrestling with some unfamiliar feelings. Meanwhile, boys will be boys except for Kyle who, for the first time, seems to see things differently from the rest of his friends.
Sharon is abnormally emotional and it's really getting Randy down.
The boys' chance of winning the Bike Parade is in jeopardy when Kenny quits.
The town finds the church doors locked and there's no sign of Butters or the Pastor.
Mr. Hankey's offensive behavior puts him in jeopardy of being fired as the Director of the Annual Christmas Pageant.
Randy moves the family to the country and he takes up farming.
The kids plan to use the latest revolution in mobility to get more candy on Halloween than they have ever gotten before.
South Park citizens are in danger and the boys realize that only Al Gore can help.
The boys break out of jail and are on the run from the police and ManBearPig.
Cartman has been diagnosed with anxiety.
South Park is chosen to be the home for Amazon's newest Fulfillment Center.
Randy fights against home-grown. Meanwhile, Kyle goes to camp.
Randy sees an opportunity for Tegridy in China.
Randy celebrates the success of Tegridy Farms while Cartman refuses to get a shot.
Cartman is sure the new plant-based diet in the school cafeteria gave him a heart attack.
It's Halloween and Randy is dealing with his daughter's marijuana problem.
The citizens of South Park have had enough of Randy and Tegridy Farms and they just want to lock him up.
The boys travel to the Costa Rica as a part of the "Getting Gay with Kids" choir tour.
Korn comes to South Park for a Halloween concert and helps the boys solve a spooky pirate ghost mystery.
Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny are caught up in the latest fad from Japan: Chinpoko Mon!
To help Cartman win the school spelling bee, Cartman's Mom gives him the Hooked on Monkey Fonics spelling system.
Starvin' Marvin returns to South Park with an alien spaceship and enlists Cartman, Stan, Kyle and Kenny's help to seek out a new home for his starving people.
Cartman has visions of glory as he suits up for the Confederacy in the annual reenactment of a Civil War battle, and leads the drunken rebels to defeat the union.
An extravaganza of holiday songs are performed in unique South Park style, hosted by Mr. Hankey.
People from all over the world start to gather outside Jesus' house waiting for a millennium miracle.
The children of South Park are invited to Arkansas for the "Four Million Child Blow 2000", the first worldwide recorder concert.
When the citizens of South Park start exploding randomly, the mayor enlists Stan's dad, the resident geologist, to find a solution to the problem.
Chef's parents arrive in South Park from Scotland fresh from an encounter with the Loch Ness Monster to attend Chef's wedding.
The boys discover a prehistoric creature called a Jakovasaur while camping at Stark's Pond.
The boys instigate a fight between Tweek and Craig in shop class. Meanwhile, Mr. Adler, the shop teacher, is haunted by a recurring dream of his lost love.
After Sexual Harassment Panda "educates" the children, Cartman sues Stan for sexual harassment, and a flurry of other lawsuits follow.
While all the adults are gathering at Mr. Mackey's house to watch a meteor shower Shelly Marsh is left babysit Cartman.
Stan's parents drag him along to Mr. Mackey's meteor shower party, where he is sent down into the basement to play with Pip, Butters and Dougie.
Kyle invites Kenny to join him and Ike at Jewbilee, a camp for Jewish kids.
When Cartman discovers the Tooth Fairy is paying a premium price for his lost teeth, he and the boys seize the opportunity to make some cash.
Cartman's flock begins to grow and the children begin plans to build him a Church. Meanwhile, Satan turns to God for advice.
The boys devise a plan to travel back in time a full year and return to the third grade, with the help of Timmy and his electronic wheelchair.
When Cartman finally stops bragging about his new Trapper Keeper, a stranger informs him that it will eventually take over the world and destroy humankind, if they do not destroy it first.
When Pip is offered the opportunity to become a gentleman he goes to London only to discover that Miss Havisham plans to break his heart.
Cartman's family and friends have intervened and are forcing him to trim down. While Cartman's away, Kenny's star is on the rise when he gets his own reality TV show.
To get back at his parents for not letting him go to a concert, Kyle tells the police that his parents molested him. Soon, the whole town is free of adults and divided into two rival cities.
When Mr. Hankey skips Christmas, the boys find him living with his alcoholic wife and their three little nuggets. He tells them that no one is into Christmas anymore.
Cartman is pursued by the FBI for committing a hate crime and lands in juvenile hall.
When Timmy is diagnosed with Attention Deficit Disorder, it triggers a wave of prescription drug abuse at South Park Elementary.
8-year-old contorting quintuplets from Romania defect to the United States and seek shelter with Stan's family.
Cartman decides to seek friendship using the Internet, and finds an older man who is more than willing to be his friend...and more.
Kyle needs a kidney transplant and Cartman is discovered to be the perfect donor. Cartman gladly offers his kidney to Kyle—for the price of $10 million dollars.
Chef's passionate protest declaring the South Park flag racist enflames the entire town.
"Fingerbang" is the newest boy band starring all the boys and it's also Cartman's latest scheme to make a million dollars.
The boys learn in Sunday school that they must confess their sins, but worry about Timmy since all he can say is his own name.
The you-know-what hits the fan 162 times when the citizens of South Park tune in to hear the word "shit" on a popular TV show.
Cartman gets Kenny's school picture on every "missing child" milk carton in the country.
Mr. Garrison gets fed up with long lines, delayed flights and the airline industry in general and invents his own transportation device.
Token is tired of being the only rich kid in town, and succeeds in attracting several other wealthy families to South Park.
In a very special episode of "South Park," Cartman fights for Kenny's life when he speaks before Congress in favor of stem-cell research.
Alone and lost, Butters determinedly makes his way through porn theatres and gay bathhouses in an effort to get his dad back home in time to eat at Bennigan's for his parents' anniversary.
Big Gay Al returns to South Park as the new scout leader. When he is fired for being gay, the boys rally to his defense with the help of the new "handi-capable" kid, Jimmy.

Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny discover David Blaine, magician and cult leader, performing in the streets of South Park. Stan finds out early that the Blainiacs are not as nice as everyone thinks. He tries to convince the other boys they have been brainwashed, but they have forsaken their friends and families. Teaming up with Jesus, Stan calls upon all the Super Best Friends to destroy the magician and thwart the mass suicide pact he has launched.
After the other boys explain to Cartman that pubes do not count unless you grow your own, Cartman realizes he has been tricked by the school bully, Scott Tenorman.
When the boys discover Terrance and Phillip have called it quits, they will go to any lengths to reunite the duo and recruit them for South Park's Earth Day festivities.
Cartman inherits a million dollars from his grandmother and fulfills his lifelong dream of owning his own amusement park: Cartmanland!
In a time-honored tradition and right-of-passage, the boys are separated from the girls and schooled in the mysteries of sex by none other than Mr. Mackey.
When the government steals their new Gamesphere, the boys will stop at nothing to get it back.

The kids of South Park have raised money to send to the children of Afghanistan, but the Government believes the Afghani children's thank you gift is contaminated with Anthrax and the boys are forced to take it back to Afghanistan.
As the country becomes obsessed with a popular program for losing weight, the boys see an opportunity to become sponsored by a major restaurant chain.
Cartman gets kicked out of the gang when Bebe develops boobs and the boys lose their minds, threatening their friendships and society as we know it.
In an effort to protect their children from kidnappers, the parents hire the owner of City Wok Restaurant to build the Great Wall of South Park.
Kenny died with the winning ticket to a prize of endless candy in his pocket. The boys decide to build a ladder to Heaven where they expect to find him and get the ticket back.
The boys embark upon a mythical quest as they set out to return their copy of the "The Lord of the Rings" movie to their local video store.
The boys are sentenced to the Death Camp of Tolerance where they learn how to treat minorities. Mr. Slave and Lemmiwinks make their debut in this episode.
When a famous psychic fails to help him exorcise Kenny from his body, Cartman and Chef travel to the moors of Scotland, where Chef's mom tries a little of her voodoo magic on him.
When a 32-year-old man claiming to be Stan from the future shows up in South Park, young Stan is forced to come to terms with the loser he will become.

Cartman has to score one big "nice" to be eligible for Christmas presents this year. He recruits Santa, Mr. Hankey and Jesus in a desperate attempt to bring Christmas to the downtrodden citizens of Iraq.
While the adults trapped at a time-share sales meeting, Stan is challenged by the best skier on the mountain.
When the boys learn that talk shows offer prizes to people who are grossly disfigured they can't sign Butters up fast enough.
Stan is appalled when he realizes the veal he's been eating is, in fact, the meat from little baby calves.
All the kids in South Park are glued to the TV, wild with anticipation to see the first trailer for the latest Terrance and Phillip movie.
The boys fire Butters as their new friend. Devastation over his rejection unleashes Butters' dark side and Professor Chaos is born.
Professor Chaos is frustrated when he realizes all of his diabolical plans to wreak havoc on South Park have already been done by "The Simpsons."
A sexual abuse scandal involving priests hits South Park and is taken all the way to the Vatican.
When the boys find out that their favorite movies are being enhanced, re-released and ruined in the process, they form a club to "Save Films from their Directors."
Stan, Cartman, Kyle and Kenny find out that planet Earth is just one big intergalactic reality show and it's about to be cancelled.
With South Park's senior citizens behind the wheel, more than a few farmer's markets have been mowed down. Unwilling to surrender their driver's licenses, the elderly fight back.
Kyle chooses Stan, Kenny and Butters to celebrate his birthday at Casa Bonita. When Cartman finds out he's not invited, he arranges for Butters to conveniently go "missing."
A Mormon kid moves to South Park and it's up to Stan to kick his ass. But when Stan and his dad meet their new Mormon neighbors, they become fascinated with how genuinely nice they are.
After singing and dancing representatives from an anti-smoking campaign rap about the dangers of smoking, the kids at South Park Elementary realize how cool it really is and take up the habit.
After Wendy breaks up with Stan the boys take him to "Raisins," a local restaurant known for its great chicken wings and hot girls.
The town decides to cancel Christmas and take up a collection when Ike's Canadian birth parents show up unexpectedly and want their baby back.
Jimmy and Timmy pull together a group of people like themselves and call their new club the "Crips."
Cartman convinces the boys to "toilet paper" their teacher's house, but Kyle is overwhelmed with guilt.
The boys join some anti-war protesters because it is a free pass out of school for the day.
One of Cartman's body parts becomes famous overnight and rivals the popularity of another superstar.
After they return a missing doll to a little girl, the police department recognizes the boys' efforts and officially names them "junior deputies."
The citizens of South Park are being forced off their land to make way for a new super highway after owners of the Three Feathers Indian Casino acquire the town.
When the other boys kick Cartman out of their band, he pulls his own group together to make music for Jesus.
The boys are transformed into Japanese Warriors after they trick a vendor and buy martial arts weapons at a local flea market.
The kid who took the fall for the boys five years ago is getting out of Juvie, and his first order of business is revenge.[2]
The boys of South Park produce their own morning news show on the school's closed-circuit television station and are immediately caught up in an intense competition for ratings.
Disturbed by the corruptive influence Paris Hilton has on all little girls in South Park, one of the town's favorite citizens challenges her to a "whore-off."
After sustaining a severe head injury, Cartman appears to have the power to see into the future. South Park detectives are quick to enlist his help in cracking unsolved murder cases.
Stan agrees to help a group of adorable Woodland Critters build a manger in anticipation of the birth of their Lord and Savior, only to find out that they serve Satan.
Jimmy is in training for the upcoming Special Olympics and he's determined to win at any cost.
Kyle finally sees the blockbuster movie "The Passion of the Christ" and admits that Cartman has been right about the Jewish people all along.
Stan just got served, and now it's up to him to put together a team of South Park's best dancers to compete against a troupe from Orange County.
Cartman plans to learn all of Butters' innermost secrets and then use them against him, by pretending to be Butters' new best friend, a robot named AWESOM-O 4000.
The children of South Park are attracted to "Mr. Jefferson," the new neighbor in town, and Cartman goes out of his way to get "Mr. Jefferson" to love him best.
Humans from the year 4035 are traveling to South Park through a recently opened time portal and are looking for work.
A PETA protest against the use of a cow as South Park Elementary's mascot forces the student body to choose a new one.
In order to save South Park, Stan and Kyle have to find a way to destroy the ever-expanding Wall-Mart superstore while keeping Cartman from stabbing them in the back.
As Mr. Garrison enjoys his new womanly attributes after his sex change, the rest of the town gets in touch with their inner feelings too.
After the sudden on-set of the disease Gingervitis, Cartman rallies all other ginger kids to rise up and assume their role as the master race.

Scientologists converge on Stan's house after he is identified as the reincarnation of L. Ron Hubbard. One A-lister locks himself in the closet and refuses to come out after Stan criticizes his "talent."

The boys try to rescue their new friend Willzyx, a talking space whale, from the Denver Sea Park and with the help of MASA (Mexican Aeronautica y Spacia Administracion) get him home to the moon for $200.
Stan is embarrassed when his dad gets pulled over for drunk driving. Randy believes that only one thing can save him from his "disease," a bleeding statue of the Virgin Mary in the next town.
When hippie drum circles start popping up in people's attics and backyards the citizens of South Park have no choice but to turn to Eric Cartman for help.
The boys set up a talent agency and pool all their resources and impress their first client only to have another agency steal him away.
Kenny is the only one of his friends to get the newest, coolest portable gaming device and Cartman cannot deal with it. Will they remain best friends forever?
The kids desperately want an end to the boring baseball season. The problem is, they keep winning.
Cartman is sure he's dead and Butters is sure that Eric Cartman's ghost is haunting him. Together they attempt to make amends to all the people Cartman has wronged over the years.
The South Park Elementary School Talent Show is coming up and Jimmy can't wait to perform his comedy routine, but first he must find a way to gain control of his raging hormones.
A Global Warming State of Emergency is declared in South Park as the world's largest beaver dam breaks and floods the adjacent town of Beaverton.
Butters must fake his death, dress up as a girl and infiltrate a slumber party, in order to retrieve a future telling device Cartman is convinced the girls have.
